intro: Siparuna guianensis var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved siparuna, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and pleasant scent.
